website_summaries.verdict: Reaper of Souls, the expansion to Diablo III, adds a new class, a new chapter, and several very welcome changes to the original game's formula.
pros: New class, act, and features make the game feel different and more satisfying
cons: $40 seems a little pricey for a quarter of the content of Diablo III itself

customer_reviews.title: Diablo III
customer_reviews.text: I have played the Diablo games since the very beginning and they keep getting better. This expansion is no different, sure you only get one new act and one new class but you also get to do rifts and bounties which add more to the game. Plus the one new act you get seems to be longer than the first ones but that could just be me. The only thing that I can really complain about doesn't have to do with this expansion it's self but the entire Diablo III and that is you have to have the internet to play which limits where you can play or you get disconnected a lot if your internet is acting up.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Olsen

customer_reviews.title: I waited years for disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I played the original Diablo, the expansion pack, Diablo II, and the Diablo II expansion. I had 3 characters I saved that had beat the game and waited for Diablo III. Diablo III is just plain disappointing. It is very limited in play time and lacks challenge at normal difficulty. I beat the game with my 1st character without coming close to dying. My saved characters are not transferable, I might as well delete them. I am currently trying Grim Dawn and can say; just starting to play it, it is a much better game. Don't waste your time and money on Diablo III.
customer_reviews.author: CL newell

customer_reviews.title: So much shorter than it should be
customer_reviews.text: So much shorter than it should be. Come on, I paid about the same for this extension as the first part and it took me less time to finish. Now if I want to keep going I have to pay another $20 to be another character?! That is not much of an incentive. The other character(necromancer) should be free with the first extension. How many people want to buy extensions piece mail? I really wanted a more intense experience but was met with a feeling of "is that all?".
customer_reviews.author: Xandar the Destroyer

customer_reviews.title: Fun game to play.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big Blizzard and Diablo fan, loved Diablo 1 and 2, this one is fun but I wish they would have kept more of the game play design from the first and second games. In this game, the magic users only seem to use their spells to attack even if they have a big club in their hand, and sometimes you just need to bash the creature instead of blasting it with a spell that is meant to take down much larger monsters. Still it's fun to play, so far my favorite character to play is the Demon Hunter. This expansion adds quite allot to the game play.
customer_reviews.author: FletcherTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Redemption for a Classic
customer_reviews.text: As a fan of the original Diablo and its sequel, Diablo 3 was a bit of a disappointment. The real money auction house detracted from the experience rather than adding to it - nevermind the ridiculously atrocious droprate of legendary items. Thankfully, Reaper of Souls has changed all of that and made Diablo 3 a modern day classic. If you are still undecided, there is no need to be - this expansion makes up for the misgivings of version 1. You may regret getting addicted to the point and click of an ARPG, but you won't regret spending the money on this.

I deducted one star because the game did revert back to repetitive loot finding click fest after a week or two of play (which is addictive and fun). To me the content is worth $15-$20, just don't buy it used because the key code (and thus the game) with be useless.

customer_reviews.title: Nice expansion to the third installment of a pinnacle dungeon-crawl

The expansion did exactly what it's supposed to do - it gave us more story and more to do in the game! With this xpac, there were some sweeping changes as to how the game operates: Improved/smarter loot, no more auction house, greater flexibility when it comes to challenge levels, etc. Highly recommended to fans of the series, and to those who like dungeon crawls in general!

The new seasonal play system is pretty neat, enough to keep me starting a new char for the 3rd time (pre-seasonal/RoS, 1st season, 2nd season chars) but the rewards are kinda weak. customer_reviews.title: More Of The Same
customer_reviews.text: Essentially Diablo 3, but with a darker atmosphere. All of the "quirks" found in the base game are found here as well. If you didn't like the game before, this won't change your mind.

customer_reviews.title: Love the dynamic difficulty and changes in looting system
customer_reviews.text: Picking up diablo 3 again since I left two years. Love the dynamic difficulty and changes in looting system, so I don't have to worry about picking up a decent set of items to farm effectively. I can start a new character and get good rare/legendary items as I progress.

customer_reviews.title: Great Game Overall
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I really enjoyed it a lot. The story is pretty interesting and the playstyle is easy to catch onto. My own complaint, really, is that once you finish the story there isn't really a whole lot that's obvious to do anymore except grind for better gear(there are some great things to discover and figuring out all of the new classes is fun, but it's not all super obvious unless you do some digging).

product_meta.title: Diablo III: Reaper of Souls
product_meta.description:
Platform:PC/Mac| Edition:Reaper of Souls Expansion

NO ONE CAN STOP DEATH
The Prime Evil rages within the Black Soulstone, its essence screaming for vengeance and release. Before the artifact can be sealed away forever, Malthael–Angel of Death–manifests in the mortal realms with a deadly new purpose: to steal the Black Soulstone and bend its infernal power to his will. So begins the end of all things...




View larger CHARGE FORTH AS THE CRUSADER
Impenetrable armor, gleaming weapons, and heavy, heavy damage–wield the power of the Crusader, unbreakable new hero of the mortal realms.

View larger CONQUER NEW GAMEPLAY MODES
The new Adventure Mode opens up all of Sanctuary - you can travel to any waypoint in any Act. It also introduces Bounties and Nephalem Rifts, two new game features with boundless replay value.

View larger TAKE ACT V BY STORM
From the sprawling streets of Westmarch to the ancient walls of the Pandemonium Fortress, battle with a host of deadly new enemies throughout the all-new Act V of the Diablo III storyline.

View larger DISCOVER POWERFUL NEW TREASURES
A redesigned loot system improves your Diablo III experience with targeted "smart drops," new and improved Legendary items, and the item-augmenting powers of the Mystic.

View larger RISE TO NEW HEIGHTS OF POWER
Advance your hero of choice through additional levels of supremacy, mastering bold new powers of raw, demon-slaying potential along the way.
